channel.title: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"
channel.description:
Yo, im making a new MMO and i just spent £57 on an professional Terrain editor, well i just finished making my first zone, (all you need to know) Ive also made a model, I'm wondering, how would i import my model onto my terrain?
Thanks in advance.
~johno

item.title: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"
item.dc:creator: @FrostFyr FrostFÿr
item.description:
@FrostFyr wrote:

ok, this is a lil off topic, but why would you ask for help with databases in a SCAR scripting help forum? =\

Read full topic
item.source: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"

item.title: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:9, topic:286636”]That depends what you want to do. If you want to make an entire MMO yourself one day, you have fuckin’ tons to learn.

Assuming you’re not going to do that (because you’re not), pick whatever you like to do and do it. If you like terrain editing, get into level design and terrain editing. Make shitloads of levels, get really good, find someone else to do the programming.

If programming is what you want to do, start off making a smaller game. A tetris clone, a sidescrolling platformer.

Theres nothing wrong with being a jack of all trades when you’re starting out right, but jumping in at the deepend you will fail.

Why do you think all of the moparisthebest.com private servers suck so badly? Because the people who write them tried to handle one of the most complex projects you could really choose before they’d ever written anything in their life. And choked…[/quote]

yeh good point, i was getting excited because some person made his own mmo in 6 months, but i need to remember he allready had a game engine layed out, all he had to do was built onto it…

But im making something from scatch, making my own engine…

Thanks for the help!
Im think im going to stick with making the terrain and models, then maybe getting someone else to do the scripting sides, but maybe one day (Java course in the Games Dev) i will be able to take what i learnt, and build upon it.

Thanks!

~johno[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 02, 2009, 06:33:30 am[/size][hr]it would just be awesome to see a model i made on a terrain, thats all im looking for at the moment.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 02, 2009, 06:35:06 am[/size][hr]Well, is there anyway for me, to be able to get a model i made (gallows) and import it to my terrain??

Read full topic
item.source: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"

item.title: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

But uh, a database is the least of your troubles. Where is your game engine coming from? Whos going to write the code to draw the world? What world format are you using? How are you going to handle connections? How are you going to handle world/object states? How are you going to keep load on the database down with all that stuff being streamed from it? etc etc etc

All of these questions have answers ofc, but until you know them, how do you expect to be able to write an MMORPG?

Read full topic
item.source: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"

item.title: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:8, topic:286636”][quote author=ZeroFreeze link=topic=379067.msg2850972#msg2850972 date=1246537251]
If you’re interested in creating RPG’s, you will need to learn graphics design in Photoshop (for example) and you need to be advanced in the programming language that you will use.
Also, please note that I said RPG and not MMORPG.

I edited my post. You will also need to learn what databases are used for, how they function and how you can manipulate data in them.

Protip: Don’t start with RPG’s, especially 3 dimensional ones that you are wanting to make.
[/quote][/quote]
I know what a database is used for, you use it to safe information, load information of it, build all your models and terrains together in a playable state etc… I just need a little help/push into any TuTs that can help me make a basic one, but then upgrade to a very powerful one.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"

item.title: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

That depends what you want to do. If you want to make an entire MMO yourself one day, you have fuckin’ tons to learn.

Assuming you’re not going to do that (because you’re not), pick whatever you like to do and do it. If you like terrain editing, get into level design and terrain editing. Make shitloads of levels, get really good, find someone else to do the programming.

If programming is what you want to do, start off making a smaller game. A tetris clone, a sidescrolling platformer.

Theres nothing wrong with being a jack of all trades when you’re starting out right, but jumping in at the deepend you will fail.

Why do you think all of the moparisthebest.com private servers suck so badly? Because the people who write them tried to handle one of the most complex projects you could really choose before they’d ever written anything in their life. And choked…

Read full topic
item.source: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"

item.title: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:6, topic:286636”]If you’re interested in creating RPG’s, you will need to learn graphics design in Photoshop (for example) and you need to be advanced in the programming language that you will use.
Also, please note that I said RPG and not MMORPG.[/quote]

I edited my post. You will also need to learn what databases are used for, how they function and how you can manipulate data in them.

Protip: Don’t start with RPG’s, especially 3 dimensional ones that you are wanting to make.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"

item.title: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:5, topic:286636”]But an MMO is something you simply cannot do without a basic knowledge of the foundation concepts. Unpossible!

Perhaps start with something a little simpler?

By the way, which editor did you get?[/quote]

Oh sorry, £47 pounds, i got
EarthSculptor (Full version)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 02, 2009, 06:22:12 am[/size][hr][quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:6, topic:286636”][quote author=johno2 link=topic=379067.msg2850970#msg2850970 date=1246537055]
i know this, but everything starts from somewhere, im a weird learner, i pick stuff up VERY quick, but only if im doing it practically,
[/quote]
Do you start from somewhere by wanting to create an MMORPG? No, you simply do not.
Neither will you “pick this stuff up VERY quick”.

theres only a handful of information what you can take from reading on c++ languages, python etc… Without actually trying it your self.

Are you kidding? Stop now - save yourself and your parents’ money.[/quote]

Oh and trust me, im not using any of my parents money, i don’t need to, nor will i!

ok, where would you recommend i start?

Read full topic
item.source: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"

item.title: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

johno2:

i know this, but everything starts from somewhere, im a weird learner, i pick stuff up VERY quick, but only if im doing it practically,

Do you start from somewhere by wanting to create an MMORPG? No, you simply do not.
Neither will you “pick this stuff up VERY quick”.

johno2:

theres only a handful of information what you can take from reading on c++ languages, python etc… Without actually trying it your self.

Are you kidding? Stop now - save yourself and your parents’ money.

If you’re interested in creating RPG’s, you will need to learn graphics design in Photoshop (for example) and you need to be advanced in the programming language that you will use.
Also, please note that I said RPG and not MMORPG.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

But an MMO is something you simply cannot do without a basic knowledge of the foundation concepts. Unpossible!

Perhaps start with something a little simpler?

By the way, which editor did you get?

item.source: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"

item.title: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

ZeroFreeze:

Congratulations on wasting 57 pounds. You will utterly fail at “making” one - The question “i need help making a database” underlines this. It takes knowledge, time and dedication to make a successful multiplayer RPG.

i know this, but everything starts from somewhere, im a weird learner, i pick stuff up VERY quick, but only if im doing it practically, theres only a handful of information what you can take from reading on c++ languages, python etc… Without actually trying it your self.

Also, trust me i will put in as much dedication as needed, this is my dream, ive even been accepted for a Games Development course at college, so i want to get knowledge before hand, then there is more change to get passed onto uni.

Read full topic
item.source: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"

item.title: I need help making a database."Little bit of help needed still"

item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

Congratulations on wasting 57 pounds. You will utterly fail at “making” one - The question “i need help making a database” underlines this. You do not simply “import models into terrain”.

It takes knowledge, time and dedication to make a successful multiplayer RPG.
